<<<<<<< HEAD
Due correction for Mr Hobbes· Or Schoole discipline, for not saying his lessons right. In answer to his Six lessons, directed to the professors of mathematicks. / By the professor of geometry. Wallis, John, 1616-1703.
[12], 130, [2] p., folded plate
Printed by Leonard Lichfield printer to the University for Tho: Robinson., Oxford, : 1656.
Dedication signed: John Wallis. A reply to: Hobbes, Thomas. Six lessons to the professors of the mathematiques. With a final errata leaf. Annotation on Thomason copy: "7ber [i.e. September] 26". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
